business.headline: Sensex, Nifty tumble ahead of US elections; Hero MotoCorp falls 4%The NSE Nifty 50 dropped by 321.20 points to settle at 23,983.15, while the BSE Sensex fell 941.88 points to 78,782.24. Most of the broader market indices also declined sharply during the session.

Reliance Jio IPO likely in 2025, retail arm to debut much later: Report Reliance Jio IPO: The company is targeting a 2025 listing for Jio, although the retail unit's IPO is expected to follow later due to internal operational priorities.

Donald Trump vs Kamala Harris: How US elections may impact Indian stock marketWith the US election just a day away, Indian markets prepare for shifts across sectors from tech to oil. What could this high-stakes race mean for investors on Dalal Street?

Stock market crash: Adani Ports, Reliance, Bajaj Auto among top losers Market crash: The bloodbath on Dalal Street can be attributed to a combination of factors, including a disappointing Q2 earnings season, heightened caution ahead of the upcoming US presidential elections, and persistent selling by foreign institutional investors (FIIs).
US presidential elections cause market turbulence as investors grow waryThe US elections are affecting the share market, with significant impacts on bond yields and investor caution.

Panic grips Dalal Street: 4 factors behind today's stock market crashStock market today: Both benchmark indices fell as much as 2%, leading to massive losses for investors. At 12:57 pm, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,303.19 points at 78,420.93, while the NSE Nifty50 tanked 437.15 points to trade at 23,867.20.

Swiggy IPO: Check GMP, price band, lot size, dates and other key detailsSwiggy's upcoming IPO promises to be a game-changer in the food delivery market. Read on to know about the key details and what this debut could mean for the future of online delivery in India.

Explained: Why Azad Engineering share price jumped 14% despite market selloffAzad Engineering stock price: Around 12:15 pm, the shares were up 9.49% at Rs 1,599.70, giving Azad Engineering a market capitalization of Rs 9,450 crore.

Bajaj Auto share price falls over 5% today. Should you buy?Bajaj Auto share price declined sharply during Monday's trading session. Is it a good opportunity to buy the stock? Here is all you need to know.

Stock market crash: Sensex drops 1,400 points, here's how much investors lostStock market crash: Concerns mounted amid a volatile market environment driven by uncertainties surrounding the upcoming US presidential election and the Federal Reserve's potential interest rate decisions.

Afcons Infrastructure makes weak stock market debut: Sell or hold?Afcons Infrastructure IPO listing: The company's weak debut on Dalal Street has got investors wondering whether they should exit now or wait for long-term gains. Here is all you need to konw

Sensex crashes 1,100 points today: What's behind the bloodbath on D-StreetStock market crash: Sensex has declined over 1,100 points and the Nifty50 tumbled nearly 400 points in early trade. Read on to know about the factors responsible for today's bloodbath on Dalal Street.

Sensex falls over 1,000 points as foreign outflows continue; Bajaj Auto dips 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,045 points at 78,678.96 at 10:16 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 342.35 points to trade at 23,962.

Gold, silver price today, November 4, 2024: Precious metals witness dip on MCXGold Price Today November 4, 2024: Both gold and silver are trading on the lower side of the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX) on Monday. Check the latest city-wise prices here.

Explained: How Adani Power's supply cut impacts crisis-hit Bangladesh economyAdani Power's supply cut to Bangladesh intensifies existing economic challenges, raising concerns about energy security and financial stability.

Adani Power cuts half of Bangladesh electricity supply over unpaid duesThe power reduction comes at a challenging time for Bangladesh, which reported a shortfall of over 1,600 megawatts (MW) overnight. The 1,496 MW Adani plant is currently generating just 700 MW from one of its two units.

Muhurat Trading 2024: Markets end on strong note; all sectoral indices in greenMuhurat Trading 2024 has concluded, marking the arrival of Samvat 2081. The session, which took place from 6:00 PM to 7:00 PM, ended on a strong note, with the Sensex surging 335 points and the Nifty closing at 24,300. Investors actively participated, reflecting the festive spirit of the Hindu New Year through token investments aimed at attracting prosperity. All the sectoral indices ended the session in green, with M&M, ONGC, Adani Ports and BEL emerging as the top gainers. On the other hand, the top losers were Dr Reddy's, HCLTech, Britannia, Tech Mahindra and Adani Enterprises.

Muhurat Trading 2024: Check timings, stock recommendations, all key detailsMuhurat Trading today: The pre-opening session will begin at 5:45 PM, and all intraday positions will be automatically squared off 15 minutes before the session's close, necessitating careful planning for same-day trades.

Muhurat trading 2024: Check stock picks, trading strategy and expert insightsMuhurat trading is not just a unique market session; it's a cherished tradition where investors make token investments to invoke the blessings of Goddess Lakshmi, the goddess of wealth.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Judiciary's independence doesn't mean deciding against government: Chief JusticeWhile addressing an event in Delhi on Monday, the Chief Justice said that when he struck down the electoral bonds scheme and ruled against the Centre, he was called "very independent".
Seek forgiveness at temple or pay Rs 5 crore: Salman Khan gets fresh threatSeek forgiveness at temple or pay Rs 5 crore: Fresh threat from Bishnoi gang to Salman Khan

How Indian women in US outdo men in their love for Kamala HarrisIn the US, six out of 10 Indian-American voters said that they intended to vote for Democratic candidate Kamala Harris. But there is a gender gap when it comes to Indians supporting Harris. While 67% of Indian-American women intend to vote for her, the percentage of men planning to vote for her is lower at 53%.

Thousands march in solidarity after pro-Khalistani attack on Canada Hindu templeThe solidarity march on Monday night organised by the Coalition of Hindus in North America, came a day after the pro-Khalistani attack on the Hindu Sabha temple in Brampton.

Video: Viral hippo Moo Deng predicts who will win US presidential electionMoo Deng, the viral pygmy hippo in Thailand, 'predicted' the 2024 US presidential election winner by choosing between two fruit cakes.

Video: MiG-29 fighter jet spins out of control moments before crash near AgraIn a viral video, some onlookers see the MiG-29 fighter jet of the Indian Air Force falling fast in a flat spin before it hit the ground and burst into flames near Agra. The pilot survived after he ejected himself to safety.

Indian American voices 'will roar' in this election: Joe Biden's advisorNeera Tanden, a senior advisor to President Biden, in an exclusive interview with India Today, highlighted Kamala Harris's unique connection to India through her heritage and personal experiences, which could strengthen bilateral ties.

Gavaskar cites Tendulkar's 'preparation' example after India's series lossIn an exclusive interview with India Today, Sunil Gavaskar gave Sachin Tendulkar's example and talked about the importance of preparing well before taking on quality bowlers at the international level.

Harris different than Hillary Clinton: Indian-American Congressman explains whyUS Vice-President and Democratic presidential candidate Kamala Harris is ahead in national polls and has the support of a large number of American women, Indian-American Congressman Shri Thanedar said.

Sathyabama's RISE - Building a Stronger FutureSathyabama Institute of Science and Technology stands out as a beacon of educational excellence and social responsibility. Under the visionary leadership of Chancellor Dr. Mariazeena Johnson, this institution is redefining what it means to be a premier university in India, transforming lives through both world-class education and impactful community initiatives.

Pawan Kalyan's call for action against Hindu violence after Canada temple attackJana Sena Party chief Pawan Kalyan condemned the recent attack on a Hindu temple in Canada, calling out the international community to acknowledge and address the suffering of Hindus across the world.

New York's ballots include an Indian language. It's not HindiBy law, New York City is obligated to provide voting materials in Bengali at certain poll sites. This mandate extends beyond just ballot papers to include other essential voting materials, ensuring comprehensive language support for Bengali-speaking voters.

11 years of Mangalyaan: When India travelled to Mars on a budgetLess than a year after its launch, on September 24, 2014, Mangalyaan achieved what many considered impossible, becoming the first Asian spacecraft to reach Mars.

Canadian cop suspended for attending pro-Khalistan protest outside Hindu templeHarinder Sohi, a Sergeant of the Peel Regional Police, was suspended by authorities after a video of him participating in a pro-Khalistan protest outside a Hindu temple in Brampton went viral on social media.

Prayers offered at Kamala Harris's village in Tamil Nadu for her win in US pollsPrayers were offered at Thulasendrapuram in Tamil Nadu, which is the ancenstral village of US Presidential candidate and Vice President Kamala Harris, for her victory. The US election will be held on November 5, where the Vice President and former president Donald Trump as in a neck-to-neck contest.

Devendra Fadnavis says 'no musical chair' for chief minister's post in MahayutiSpeaking to India Today TV, BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis said the Mahayuti alliance already has a policy in place for choosing the next chief minister, adding that "no musical chair" will take place for the same.

Bid to trample Bangladesh Hindu protests: Monk charged with seditionChinmoy Krishna Das Brahmachari, a Hindu monk and one of the 18 people facing sedition charges in Bangladesh, told India Today Digital that the case was an attempt to finish off the leadership spearheading the protests for minority rights. He said Monday was the deadline for the withdrawal of the sedition case.

Amaran director reveals reason for not specifying Major Mukund's casteSivakarthikeyan-starrer Amaran, directed by Rajkumar Periasamy, is a biopic on Major Mukund Varadarajan's life. A section of people criticised the film for not mentioning late Mukund's caste in the film.

Deeply concerning: S Jaishankar on attack on Hindu temple in CanadaSo far, three people have been arrested in connection with the pro-Khalistan attack at the Hindu Sabha temple in Canada's Brampton on Monday.

PM slams Canada Hindu temple attack, cowardly attempt to intimidate diplomatsPM Modi strongly reacted to the recent attack on a Hindu temple in Canada's Brampton and called on the Canadian government to ensure justice and uphold the rule of law.

Elon Musk's $1 million giveaway to voters can continue, Pennsylvania judge rulesThe $1 million-a-day voter sweepstakes hosted by Elon Musk's political action committee in swing states can proceed through Tuesday's presidential election, Pennsylvania judge ruled.

Army resumes patrolling at Depsang as disengagement progresses along LACPatrolling at Point 10 in the Depsang Plains, marking a significant step toward de-escalation and peace along the Line of Actual Control.

As a result, Karan Veer Mehra, Chaahat Pandey, Rajat Dalal, and others found themselves in the danger zone.

SRK dubs for Mufasa, exits studio at midnight; AbRam leaves with SuhanaShah Rukh Khan and his son AbRam were seen at a recording studio in Mumbai. They are dubbing the Hindi version of Mufasa: The Lion King. The film releases in December 2024.

Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 box office Day 4: Kartik's film inches closer to Rs 150-crore markKartik Aaryan's Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3 earned Rs 17.50 crore on Day 4. The film is facing tough competition from Ajay Devgn's Singham Again in theatres.

Amaran box office Day 5: Sivakarthikeyan film earns Rs 10 crore on MondayDirector Rajkumar Periasamy's Amaran, starring Sivakarthikeyan and Sai Pallavi, passed the crucial Monday test. The film earned Rs 10 crore (nett) in India on Monday, November 4.

sports.headline: Sunil Gavaskar explains why Indian Test batters are failing vs spinLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has dissected why Indian batters have struggled to bat against spin amid their recent dismal performances.

Guardiola sees challenging season for injury-hit City with Sporting nextManchester City will have a more difficult season as they deal with injuries that make it difficult to replicate their current success, manager Pep Guardiola warned ahead of their Champions League match against Sporting on Tuesday.

Haris Rauf rues not defending 203 in first ODI vs Australia: We were untidyPakistan fast bowler Haris Rauf rued not being able to defend 203 in the first ODI vs Australia as they lost the match by two wickets.

Why R Ashwin should not be written off ahead of Australia seriesStar India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin had a terrible time in the New Zealand series. The spinner picked up only 9 wickets from 3 Test matches, and was faced a lot of cricticism. But here's why Indian fans should not count him out ahead of the Australia tour.

No one in New Zealand even dreamt of 3-0 win vs India: Will YoungWill Young, player of the series in IND vs NZ said that no one even dreamt of a whitewash when they arrived in India. CSK will occasionally rest MS Dhoni to get best out of him in IPL 2025: PontingRicky Ponting suggested that CSK may rest MS Dhoni occasionally in IPL 2025 to maximise his impact. Despite stepping back from captaincy, Dhoni's experience, leadership, and finishing skills remain invaluable for the franchise's ambitions for a 6th title.

Pat Cummins warms up for Border Gavaskar Trophy with captain's show AUS vs PAK: Pat Cummins looked at his very best when Pakistan and Australia faced each other in the Melbourne ODI on Monday. Cummins picked up two wickets and scored an unbeaten 32 at the iconic venue.

ICC introduces Women's Champions Trophy, Sri Lanka to host first edition Sri Lanka are all set to host the inaugural edition of the Women's Champions Trophy in June-July 2027. In the new FTP for 2025-29, five global events will take place.

Expect clamour for new-look team if Kohli, Rohit fail in Australia: GavaskarSpeaking to India Today, former India captain Sunil Gavaskar said there will be clamour for wholesale changes in the Test side if Rohit Sharma and Virat Kohli fail to return to form in Australia. Rohit and Kohli failed miserably in India's shocking 0-3 loss to New Zealand in the recently-concluded Test series.

Forget WTC Final, India should focus on winning series in Australia: GavaskarAustralia vs India: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar has stressed that India are not going to beat Australia 4-0 away from home and force their entry into the World Test Championship Final. Gavaskar however believes that India should focus on winning BGT and not on reaching the WTC Final.

Mohammad Rizwan loses on ODI captaincy debut, but happy with Pakistan's MCG fightAustralia vs Pakistan, 1st ODI: Mohammad Rizwan praised the fighting effort of the visiting team despite losing the ODI series opener in Melbourne on Monday, November 4. Pakistan nearly defended a 203-run target.

Steve Smith fully prepared for Test series vs India: I can play tomorrowSenior Australia batter Steve Smith has said that he is fully ready for the Border-Gavaskar Trophy against India. Smith has said that he is in good form and has sorted out his technical issues.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
